item.title: Help me my memebrs not working!
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

Um, not quite this will not work properly. he just set a public integer. try setting these

this command.

        if (command.startsWith("membership")) {
            String member = command.substring(11);

            sendMessage("Player " + member + " has become a Member!");

            for (int a = 1; a < PlayerHandler.maxPlayers; a++) {
                if (PlayerHandler.players[a] != null) {
                    if (PlayerHandler.players[a].playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(
                            member)) {
                        PlayerHandler.players[a].playerIsMember = 1;
                    }
                }
            }

        }

This token in the first case 2.

     } else if (token.equals("character-ismember")) {
     playerIsMember = Integer.parseInt(token2);

this boolean

        playerIsMember = 0;

and this token in the second case 2:

                    } else if (token.equals("character-ismember")) {
                        playerIsMember = Integer.parseInt(token2);

and this in the savechar boolean.

			characterfile.write("character-ismember = ", 0, 21);
			characterfile.write(Integer.toString(playerIsMember), 0, Integer.toString(playerIsMember).length());
			characterfile.newLine();

and this in the savecharbackup boolean

            characterfile.write("character-ismember = ", 0, 21);
            characterfile.write(Integer.toString(playerIsMember), 0,
                    Integer.toString(playerIsMember).length());
            characterfile.newLine();

this in the last case 2:

                    } else if (token.equals("character-ismember")) {
                        playerIsMember = Integer.parseInt(token2);

then add this int.

    public int checkmembers() {
        try {
            BufferedReader in = new BufferedReader(
                    new FileReader("./data/members.txt"));
            String data = null;

            while ((data = in.readLine()) != null) {
                if (playerName.equalsIgnoreCase(data)) {
                    return 5;
                }
            }
        } catch (IOException e) {
            System.out.println("Critical error while checking members.!");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
        return 0;
    }

then it will be playerIsMember = 1;
so make it check playerIsMember and if it’s value is one then let them use the portal but if the value is 0 sendmsg or something.

Read full topic

item.title: Help me my memebrs not working!
item.dc:creator: @ginger_ninja ginger_ninja
item.description:
@ginger_ninja wrote:

no guys, in character file it says ismember = 0 or ismember = 1
but when i compile the code it says that its an error, like

[code] client.java:3970: cannot find symbol
symbol : variable ismember
location: class client
if (ismember = 1) {
^

Note: stream.java uses or overrides a deprecated API.
Note: Recompile with -Xlint:deprecation for details.
2 errors
Files Compiled Successfully!
Press any key to continue . . .

[/code][br][br][size=1]Posted on: October 21, 2008, 03:14:05 am[/size][hr]i fixed one error but the if (ismember = 1) {

still is a problem, any ideas?

can anyone tell me why?

case 7324: // Portal for members if (ismember = 1) { teleportToX = 2617; teleportToY = 3086; sendMessage("You teleport to the Members area."); } else { sendMessage("Sorry you are not a member"); sendMessage("please talk to Owner/Co about this!"); } break;
